rules: Rule1: If sterilizing equipment is available, then it is operational.
Rule2: Either sterilizing equipment is available or, whenever technician 1 is trained in aseptic technique, they are certified in sterile processing.
Rule3: Under the condition that the active ingredient passes quality control, production of batch 1 is approved.
Rule4: If the excipient passes quality control, then production of batch 2 is approved.
Rule5: Given that the formulation meets specification, either the active ingredient passes quality control or the excipient passes quality control.
Rule6: Whenever the formulation is within variance, either the active ingredient passes quality control or the excipient passes quality control.
Rule7: In the event that the manufacturing process is compliant with FDA regulations, the formulation meets specification or is within variance.
Rule8: Either the manufacturing process deviates from standard procedure or it is compliant with FDA regulations.
Rule9: Provided that corrective action is issued by the quality manager, the manufacturing process does not deviate from standard procedure.
Rule10: Either corrective action is issued by the quality manager or investigation is initiated by the quality manager.
Rule11: If investigation is initiated by the quality manager, then an audit is scheduled by the quality manager.
Rule12: Provided that an audit is scheduled by the quality manager, the manufacturing process does not deviate from standard procedure.
Rule13: If production of batch 1 is approved, then either the impurity level exceeds tolerance or, whenever the sterilization process is not validated, the raw materials are contaminated.

Rule14: In the event that production of batch 2 is approved, either the impurity level exceeds tolerance, or under the condition that the sterilization process is not validated, the raw materials are contaminated.
Rule15: If technician 1 has GMP certification, then whenever production of batch 1 is not approved and production of batch 2 is not approved, production of the test batch is rejected.
Rule16: Provided that technician 1 follows the cleaning protocol, the sterilization process is validated.
Rule17: Under the condition that technician 1 is certified in sterile processing, they follow the cleaning protocol.
Rule18: If it is not the case that sterilizing equipment being available implies it is not operational, then maintenance is scheduled for sterilizing equipment.
Rule19: Provided that it is not the case that sterilizing equipment being available implies it is not operational, then maintenance is not scheduled for sterilizing equipment.
Rule20: If production of batch 1 is not approved and production of batch 2 is not approved, then production of the test batch is not rejected.
Rule21: If the sterilization process is not validated, then the raw materials are not contaminated.
facts: Fact2: Technician 1 is trained in aseptic technique.
Fact3: The impurity level does not exceed tolerance.
